issue.title: [CF 828] compare current combat stats to baseline stats
issue.body:
Hi

Your addon is great but there's one thing missing to be perfect: a condition to directly evaluate short buffs (trinkets, heroism, cooldowns...) combined power.
Something like: 100 - (("baseline combat stats" + "baseline buffs") * 100 / "current combat stats").
"baseline stats" = primary stat * haste * crit * mastery provided by gears
"baseline buffs" = primary stat * haste * crit * mastery provided by group/raid
"current combat stats" = total current primary stat * haste * crit * mastery

So the result will be an estimation in percent of combined short buffs. I know it's not perfect for all abilities, because they have specific formulas and coefficients but most of the time all the buffed stats are relevant and it would give a pretty accurate and useful result. Maybe it would be misleading for some unusual abilities but a disclaimer should do the trick...

Perhaps we could achieve similar results currently but it would require too many intricate conditions and have this information directly available would simplify many setup.

If it's a too big job or inefficient to include it in tellmewhen maybe you could use the information from other addons like mesmash! (http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/mesmash/) or affdots (http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/affdots/)

already thank you!

Updated formula and added some explanation


> Posted by CurseForge user fluxtendu | Imported from CurseForge issue #828 | Raw

comments.body:
The breakpoints at which certain abilities become more useful than others do not depend on the increase in stats above the base provided by your gear and persistent buffs. They depend on the actual values of these stats, and those can be checked using the existing player combat stats conditions.

Sorry, but a feature like this would be far too redundant with other existing features.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

With some scarce resources, the optimal way to spend them is to wait combined short buffs, that could make a huge dps difference.

Currently we use rules with buff name, but it's not very flexible. They are many short buffs with different stats/values. On my warlock, I have to assess 9 potential short buffs + 2 raid short buffs + combat specifics buffs, even if I forget the smaller, I couldn't realistically setup reliable rules with the current options. And I don't think it's specific to warlock.

Moreover And/Or logical operators are not enough to evaluate combat stats correctly, to evaluate combined dps buff of an ability we need some others mathematical operators (* , / , + , -) and that would need an almost complete redesign of the addon...

So, here is my solution...
